subject: RE: [junit] Re: JavaDocs
msgSnippet: ... ok (i think) - seems very strange to have stuff in different directories that are in the *same* package. ... it does work though thanks ... ray tayek
messageBody:
At 11:48 AM 2/22/02 +0000, you wrote:
>No, just that the initial directory is different , the package structure
>remains the same:
>eg.
>
>project_root
> | -- src -- com -- myapp
> |
> | -- test-- com -- myapp

ok (i think) - seems very strange to have stuff in different directories
that are in the *same* package. ...
it does work though
thanks

> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Ray Tayek [mailto:rtayek@...]
> > Sent: 22 February 2002 11:31
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [junit] Re: JavaDocs
> >
> >
> > At 09:53 AM 2/21/02 -0800, you wrote:
> > >First, let's get to the initial topic of this thread.
> > >
> > >As posted previousely by several other fellow developers,
> > you can always
> > >have two source paths, one for the source and one for the test cases.
> > > In this way, JavaDoc will not have any problems any more. ...
> >
> > pm4ji, but are you implying that the source for test classes
> > will be in a
> > different directory? (this would mean that the test class can
> > not belong to
> > the same package as class that it is testing).
> >
> > thanks
> >
